questions.question_text: Which two products that perform lifecycle management for virtual instances are supported by WAN Edge cloud routers? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Lifecycle management:
VMware vCenter, OpenStack
C and D

Selected Answer: CD
Lifecycle management:
VMware vCenter, OpenStack

C & D
A and B are not lifecycle management products. C and D is the correct answer. See table 2 (last line in the table) in the referenced document. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/nb-07-cloud-router-data-sheet-cte-en.html
Correct

A and B are not lifecycle management products. C and D is the correct answer. See table 2 (last line in the table) in the referenced document. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/nb-07-cloud-router-data-sheet-cte-en.html
A, B is Correct

comments.content: I tried to retract this but couldn't, C & D are correct.

discussion.content: A & B. AWS and Azure are supported by WAN Edge cloud routers. Read the link above.

Given Answer is correct. Check on the provided link.
Dont get it confused with the supported Hypervisor (VMware ESXi and KVM) it runs on !!

B is the answer
https://developer.cisco.com/docs/sdwan/#!authentication/how-to-authenticate

Selected Answer: B
GET https://{vmanage-ip-address}/dataservice/device/

questions.question_text: Which secure connection should be used to access the REST APIs through the Cisco vManage web server?

discussion.content:
C is confirmed via https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/Cisco_Cloud_onRamp_for_IaaS_AWS_Version2.html
Under Procedure 1: " You must subscribe to the Cisco SD-WAN Edge router Amazon machine images (AMIs) in your account within the AWS Marketplace."

D is confirmed via the Exam Guide or the Procedure 3 in the previous link. Exam Guide: "Configure a device template for the Cisco WAN Edge Cloud routers that will be used within the transit VPC" After this the guide specifies that you also need to deploy the template which I'm guessing also means "attach"ing it.

So it's C & D

Selected Answer: CD
Agreed C & D
Yes its correct
yes C and D

choices.D: Attach a device template to the cloud WAN Edge router to be deployed in the AWS.
choices.B: Attach the ג€AmazonCreateVPCג€ and ג€AmazonProvisionEC2ג€ permission policy to the IAM account.
choices.C: Subscribe to the SD-WAN Edge router AMI in the AWS account.
choices.A: Attach an OSPF feature template to the AWS cloud Edge router template.
choices.E: Preprovision the transit VPC in the AWS region.

questions.question_text: Which two prerequisites must be met before the Cloud onRamp for IaaS is initiated on vManage to expand to the AWS cloud? (Choose two.)

DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the steps from the left into the order on the right to upload software on vManage repository that is accessible from Maintenance > Software
Repository.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
1. Click the Repository button located in the title bar.
2. Click Add New Software
3. Select the location to store the software image:
4. Click Upload to add the image to the software repository. The Software Repository tables displays the added 
software image, and it is available for installing on the devices.

This is stupid cisco approach.
Answer presented is correct.

questions.question_text: A network administrator is configuring an application-aware firewall between inside zones to an outside zone on a WAN Edge router using vManage GUI. Which kind of inspection is performed when the `inspect` action is used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D answer

Selected Answer: D
D is correct answer

Selected Answer: D
D. stateful inspection for TCP and UDP

comments.content: From firewall basics: You are right UDP is stateless but Firewall can inspect that UDP flow and allow the returning traffic.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
this is networking basic knowledge, how can udp be statefully inspected? it is not a stefull protocol so choose whatever but not D

Selected Answer: D
A firewall policy is a type of localized security policy that allows stateful inspection of TCP, UDP, and ICMP data traffic flows. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/ios-xe-16/security-book-xe/enterprise-firewall.html
Looks to be correct one.

choices.C: IPS inspection for TCP and Layer 4 inspection for UDP
choices.B: stateful inspection for TCP and stateless inspection of UDP
choices.D: stateful inspection for TCP and UDP
choices.A: Layer 7 inspection for TCP and Layer 4 inspection for UDP
